text: Agrellite (NaCa2Si4O10F) is a mineral found in Quebec, Canada and a few other locations. Agrellite displays pink fluorescence under both shortwave and longwave ultraviolet light.Handbook of Mineralogy It is named in honour of Stuart Olof Agrell (1913–1996).first reported in the Canadian Mineralogist (1976), vol. 14, pp. 120-126 ==References== Category:Inosilicates Category:Triclinic minerals
title: Agrellite
